name: Zesty Beer, Lemongrass, and Ginger Steak Marinade for Grilling
description: Light lager beer infused with fresh ginger, lemongrass, coriander seed, thyme, and lemon zest, plus some olive oil to help extract the aromatics' fat-soluble flavors, produces a lightly funky and herbal marinade that pairs well with fatty steaks, like boneless short ribs.
recipeYield: Makes enough marinade for about 4 to 6 (8-ounce) steaks
recipeIngredient: 1 (6-inch) length fresh lemongrass, lightly bruised with the blunt side of a knife
About 2 to 3 pounds (900g to 1.4kg) steak of your choice

recipeInstructions.text: In a large zipper-lock bag, combine beer, oil, lemongrass, lemon zest, ginger, coriander seed, thyme, and salt. Swish until salt is dissolved.
Add steak to bag, press out air, and seal. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour and up to 12 hours. When ready to cook, remove steak from marinade, blot dry with paper towels, and grill as desired.
